intro: Anemonastrum antucense, commonly known as the Antucoan starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive flowers and often medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, high-altitude environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
